intro: Hebe dorrien-smithii, commonly known as the Dorrien-Smith hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and attractive, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces showy blue or purple blooms during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
